title: Hostages of Each Other: The Transformation of Nuclear Safety since Three Mile Island
features: Rees offers the first in-depth account of the extraordinary transformation in the safety standards, operations, and management of the nation's nuclear facilities spurred by the accident at Three Mile Island. Detailing the surprising success of self-regulation within the nuclear industry, his book reveals the possibilities for effective communitarian action.
description: Joseph V. Rees is assistant professor of political science at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.
